div.span: Congratulations to all of our writers and thanks to Mr. and Mrs. Graham for their continued support of our students and community. More reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown. CLICK HERE TO VIEW THE VIDEO

Make sure to stand up and be counted DON'T FORGET! The 2020 Census will determine congressional representation, determine how hundreds of billions in federal funding every year is spent, and provide data that will impact communities for the next decade. CLICK HERE TO GO TO THE CENSUS.

Trojan Proud of PHS alum Danae' Perrymond,a 2016 grad of Gwynedd Mercy University with a major in Radiologic Technology. Danae' is on the frontline of serving our community as a Radiologic Technologist at Pottstown Hospital. She is an example of our district mission, to prepare each student,by name for success at every level. Share the news. Thanks for giving us another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown.

img.title: Devices
img.alt: Pottstown schools finally getting online learning

div.span:
Evan Brandt [email protected] @PottstownNews on Twitter
POTTSTOWN — Classes, such as they are, finally got going in earnest on April 20 at Pottstown High School. The same can be said of the middle school on Monday, April 27. But it won't be until May 4 that Pottstown elementary students get online and start getting new lessons. CLICK HERE TO READ THE ENTIRE STORY.
Thanks to Mr. Evan Brandt's Digital Notebook Blog for the report of the Pottstown School Board meeting of 4-23-2020. CLICK HERE TO GO TO EVAN BRANDT'S BLOG

For those of us trying to navigate the new Google World that many of us now live in try some of these videos from Mrs. Brightbill from our IT Department: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKxFd-MPiIn8yb1LOTmt0yA

COVID19 has presented us with many challenges to overcome. It has also put a bright light on how the lack of resources caused by the state's failure to use the fair funding formula puts Pottstown children at disadvantage to receive educational opportunities for success. Thanks to a very generous anonymous donation to the Foundation For Pottstown Education for supporting remote learning opportunities for students. Read Evan Brandt's Digital Notebook Blog for the story.

It is with great Pride that we announce for the 2nd year in a row. A Pottstown Trojan Female Basketball Player has been selected by the Pottstown Chapter of PIAA Basketball Officials for the Yogi Strom Sportsmanship Scholarship. Congratulations to Senior Captain Kawanza Hodge.Next year Kawanza will be attending St.Joseph University with a major in Bio Chemistry and hopes to become a surgeon. Trojan Proud of our student athletes, who are outstanding ambassadors of our school and community.Thank you for giving us another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown.

When it comes to caring about his community and wanting to help make a difference in the battle against COVID 19, Pottstown High School Senior Darren Groff 's efforts can not be masked. Darren has made 40 lined face masks and donated them to Children and Youth employees. Share the news. Another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown.

Proud of our student athletes who are ambassadors of our community both on and off the playing field. Their achievements in athletics and academics gives us another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown.
Yes we all need to stay home right now BUT that will not stop Pottstown School District from providing students with valuable information to assist in career pathway selection.

img.title: Student Video
img.alt: A Message From Some of Our Students

div.span: This video from some of our students has a lot of Pottstown teachers smiling right now. CLICK HERE TO SEE VIDEO.

img.title: Troiad yearbooks
img.alt: PHS Yearbook needs your pictures and stories

div.span: PHS Yearbook advisor Mrs.Yoder needs your help ASAP. Due to school closure and cancellation of student activities there are many pages that need to be filled in this year's book. Great opportunity for you to be part of the staff. Please send her pictures and stories of activities, accomplishments, future plans, coping COVID19. Use your imagination ( so long as you are school appropriate) Email to [email protected] Deadline for submission is April 17th.

img.title: RASQUEL e. rABBIT
img.alt: PSD Rasquel E. Rabbit Jumps to Healthy Living

div.span: Thanks to Mr. Baker for helping to spotlight the achievements of our student athletes.Trojan Proud of all of our student athletes.demonstrating excellence in the classroom and on the field. Thanks for giving us another reason to say Proud to be from Pottstown Share the news.Hope you have a great day. Stay safe,stay home,wash your hands and keep social distance.
